channel.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
channel.description: i hosted my server and all it seems to be working but i downloaded my client on my laptop and its saying "error connecting to server"

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Dohn Dohn
item.description:
@Dohn wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

no silly make a copy of your client folder in the original client folder make both of the ips set to 127.0.0.1 and then in the copied folder make both the ips set to your.no-ip.biz then give the copied one out to friends and stuff

no way its that easy i see people setting up “manifests” in order to get there shit online and btw i have no “gui” or “egu” which i was told is how i get my server online can somone just explain this last part for me
im forwarded, variables are good,fire wall is good,everything is good besides when i upload my copied client and put it on forums my friends cant click it or some shit…

Read full topic

item.source: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Dohn Dohn
item.description:
@Dohn wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:25, topic:462232”][quote author=Dohn link=topic=565187.msg4112986#msg4112986 date=1348714962]
ok and could u tell me what i should have in

                      server=

public static string server=

                      those are where the two ips go in the client.java file so which one should have 127.0.0.1 and which should have my no-ip

[/quote]

Okay for the desktop you are using to host, it should be set to this in Client Folder client.java

[code]
server = “127.0.0.1”;

public static String server = “127.0.0.1”;[/code]

Now for your laptop that your using to connect to the server, it should be set to this in Client Folder client.java

[code]server = “your.no-ip.biz”;

public static String server = “your.no-ip.biz”;[/code]

If this doesn’t work then your server may be set to only allow one ip to connect from your internet service provider which you would have to edit to allow more than 1[/quote]
so i put 127.0.0.1 in both of those in order to make it public?

Read full topic
item.source: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Taharahora, post:20, topic:462232”]Back to what i said earlier… being on the same DNS server it wont work using a no-ip.

logging in on hosted computer VS computer in same house on same network = same result.[/quote]

This guy is right.
If the laptop and the desktop computer are connected to the same network/router, you’re going to have some problems most likely. Best way around this is, from the host computer go to Start > Run, than type in ‘cmd’. When the black box comes up type ipconfig. Take note of the IPV4 address, this is your local network address, with-in your router/network. This should be the same number you used to port-forward. For the client on your laptop, where it asks for an IP, type in that IP, it should connect just fine to the desktop computer.

Read full topic
item.source: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“Dohn, post:13, topic:462232”]ok and could u tell me what i should have in

                      server=

public static string server=

                      those are where the two ips go in the client.java file so which one should have 127.0.0.1 and which should have my no-ip[/quote]

Okay for the desktop you are using to host, it should be set to this in Client Folder client.java

[code]
server = “127.0.0.1”;

public static String server = “127.0.0.1”;[/code]

Now for your laptop that your using to connect to the server, it should be set to this in Client Folder client.java

[code]server = “your.no-ip.biz”;

public static String server = “your.no-ip.biz”;[/code]

If this doesn’t work then your server may be set to only allow one ip to connect from your internet service provider which you would have to edit to allow more than 1

Read full topic

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Dohn Dohn
item.description:
@Dohn wrote:

[quote=“Taharahora, post:8, topic:462232”]Galkion’s client (spelled his name wrong) but it isn’t pi’s pi’s and galkions work together…

anyways, if it says your port forwarded on canyouseeme.org then its because either 1. you cant do that locally on the same DNS or 2. you have to change the ip somewhere else… is there a egui or gui.java?[/quote]

in client or server folderS? and yes im good on canyouseeme im almost definate that it has to do the ips in the java file
and i can only find "public static string server=,and server= an there both 127.0.0.1 because thats what they were originally

but i was messin around a while ago and i changed both around and even deleted both of them saved and compiled and my client still loaded and i could login and i didnt think you could do that.

an my laptop does not have any enviorment variables but neither does my desktop but i can loadand compile my server fine…

item.source: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Taharahora Taharahora
item.description:
@Taharahora wrote:

Galkion’s client (spelled his name wrong) but it isn’t pi’s pi’s and galkions work together…

anyways, if it says your port forwarded on canyouseeme.org then its because either 1. you cant do that locally on the same DNS or 2. you have to change the ip somewhere else… is there a egui or gui.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Dohn Dohn
item.description:
@Dohn wrote:

im using no-ip
dont know if it matters but it is a 317 pi

in my client folder the “client.java” i have “server=” and “public string ip=” rite now i have server at 0.0.0.0 and public string at my “no-ip.biz”
can somone correct this and maybe tell me what i put in my server folder aswell?

also… ive done edited both public static string server= and the one that just says server= and saved and compiled and nomatter what i put i can still log into my client… i thought changing those around would disable u to log in ive even deleted the ips totally and saved and compiled and it still lets me load and loginto client… can somone explain this lmao

item.title: Im running my server off my desktop an cant get on client on laptop
item.dc:creator: @AssassinsCRB AssassinsCRB
item.description:
@AssassinsCRB wrote:

You can’t use 127.0.0.1 or portforward if you are using 2 comps in the same house, use hamachi, set up a network on computer that hosts serv and join it on the laptop
